title: Casal da Coelheira 2011 Terraços do Tejo Red (Tejo)
description: This is an earthy wine with barnyard flavors. It does have some blackberry fruitiness under its more rustic character. The aftertaste has acidity and a bitter edge.

title: Castro Martin 2013 A2O Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Melon, apple and peach pit aromas are dusty but that's about it. This feels flat, with little acidity or kick. Flavors of peach and apple cider end similarly, with no vitality to the finish.

title: Bodegas Valdemar 2007 Conde Valdemar Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Extreme raisiny aromas are suggestive of P.X. Sherry. This is heavy and grabby on the palate while prune and raisin flavors are dominant. On the finish, this is overripe and ponderous, with fig and prune flavors.

title: Del Rio 2012 Estate Grown Syrah (Rogue Valley)
description: Medicinal, pungent pine-needle scents continue into the main palate. This shows barely any trace of varietal character.

title: Quady 2014 Electra Moscato (California)
description: This smells heavily of grape skins, and tastes like golden raisins. The texture is slightly fizzy and very thick, and the flavors are very sweet.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Companhia das Lezírias Herdade de Catapereiro Rosé (Tejo)
description: A strange orange-pink color for a wine that is somewhere between fruity and sweet and acid and bitter. This one hasn't found a balance.
designation: Companhia das Lezírias Herdade de Catapereiro

title: Valdelainos 2014 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: This is an underripe stench bomb with pyrazines coming at you from every direction. The nose is like a bowl of cactus and nettle, while the palate is harsh. Flavors of bitter pithy grapefruit show all that can go wrong with this variety.

title: Casa Nuestra 2012 Tinto St. Helena Red (Napa Valley)
description: A field blend of several varieties, all organically farmed, this has a pruney aroma and flavors that lean rustic and raw, with a heaviness of weight.

title: Sweet Cheeks 2012 Barrel Select Syrah (Southern Oregon)
description: This is a thin, watery wine with flavors of stem rather than fruit.

title: Paro 2013 Kaufman Sunnyslope Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Mountain)
description: This oddly perfumed and quite tannic wine is hard to decipher in terms of fruit. It remains light bodied amid the grip.

title: Paro 2013 Cloud 9 Vineyards Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Menthol and eucalyptus dominate over the indistinguishable fruit in this full-bodied, thick wine.

title: The Rule 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Small amounts of other grapes figure into this majority-Cabernet Sauvignon, including Merlot, Zinfandel and Petite Sirah. It begins with a reduced sensibility that translates into an undeniable aroma and taste of barrel and petrol.

title: Vega Sindoa 2014 Chardonnay (Navarra)
description: Stalky and foul on the nose, this Chardonnay doesn't smell inviting. Oily and heavy on the palate, this tastes of resiny oak, related cream and bland white fruits.

title: Campelo 2014 Rosé (Vinho Verde)
description: Soft and sweet, this is a light and fruity wine. Touches of raspberry are balanced by acidity. Drink now.

title: Trencalòs 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: Mild peach and quince aromas come with zero zest or edge. This lacks shape on the palate and tastes jumbled, with bland peach and tropical fruit flavors. This finishes flat as a board, with almost no lasting flavor.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: La Riojana Coop 2014 Triada Malbec (La Rioja)
description: Herbal berry aromas suggest density, and this is certainly dark full-sized and sticky. Pumped-up candied black-fruit flavors are thick and gooey, with cooked brown sugar, mint and toast flavors on the finish.

title: Lagar de Cervera 2014 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Murky mucky passion fruit and pineapple aromas are uncommon and uninviting. This feels watery and a bit citrusy, while strained mango and passion fruit flavors end bitter, pithy and lean.

title: Campelo 2014 Red (Vinho Verde)
description: Tight with shocking acidity, this wine confirms that red Vinho Verde can often be an acquired taste, perhaps best left to the local market back in Portugal.

title: Del Rio 2012 Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Rogue Valley)
description: This wine has very intense vegetal, stemmy aromas and flavors. It was aged entirely in stainless steel.

title: Bodegas Valdemar 2010 Conde de Valdemar Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Reduced medicinal raspberry and cherry aromas are more like fruit juice than wine. This is choppy and off the mark in mouthfeel, while unfamiliar jumbled flavors of jammy red berry fruits finish tannic and green.

title: Callia 2014 Alta Malbec (Tulum Valley)
description: Muddy plum and berry aromas lead to a sharp, rugged palate. Tart plum and pie cherry flavors end raw, rough and bitter.

title: Heartache 2011 Red (California)
description: This basic wine that has earthy aromas, slightly pruney flavors and a smooth-enough texture.

title: Luis Segundo Correas 2015 Valle Las Acequias Clase A Chardonnay (Mendoza)
description: Odd aromas of bath soap and tropical fruits are not convincing for Chardonnay. A narrow diluted palate offers low-level lemon and tropical-fruit flavors in front of a sour underwhelming finish.

title: Ashokawna 2014 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: An exceptionally young wine that tastes like bacon and cherry syrup, this offers an overripe, concentrated and thick drink experience.

title: Michel Torino 2014 Coleccion Malbec (Calchaquí Valley)
description: Aromas of spearmint gum along with a weird coating of oak create a challenging nose. This is high in acidity, to the point of feeling shearing. Sour herbal plum flavors finish rough and bracing.

title: Robert Oatley 2012 Pocketwatch Pinot Noir (Victoria)
description: A disappointing blend of wine sourced from Mornington and Yarra, this is a bit pale in color, with a Sherried edge to the fruit and some astrigency on the finish.

title: Hawthorne Ridge 2013 Chardonnay (Cariñena)
description: Strange yeasty unfocused aromas are unclean. This is flat and spineless, with yeasty papaya flavors. A diluted, leesy finish confirms that it's not ready for prime time.

title: Andeluna 2015 1300 Chardonnay (Valle de Uco)
description: Cidery, citric and jumbled on the nose and palate, this is barely cutting it. Briny, limited flavors of mealy citrus fruits finish flat.

title: Vega de Tera 2014 Halcon Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
description: This is a heartbeat or two from being DOA. Tan in color with an oily heavy mouthfeel, this tastes oxidized and shows almost no pulse.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

title: Mountain Door 2014 Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Herbaceous red-fruit and forced fiery oak aromas give this a spicy, almost Pinot Noir-like nose. Raw as nails on the palate, this tastes like herbal green strawberry and chemicals. Weedy on the finish.
